The bright moon stirs earthly emotions, As vibrant brushes cradle my spirit. Longing lingers, never to fade, In circles round and round once more.

title: èšè‘‰æ½‘æˆåƒé»å¢¨ï¼ç•«èŠ
titleEn: Splashes of Ink from Gathered Leaves: A Chrysanthemum Painting
descriptionEn: After the verses, I play with my brush in a wild spirit, Is it not a futile contest of colors and hues? Gathering leaves, I splash a thousand dots of ink, Piling flowers, I dye a few traces of frost. In the subtle interplay of light and shade, I grasp the shadows before the wind, Breaking free, autumn's fragrance dances from my wrist. Do not mistake the idle gathering at the eastern fence, For I linger here, seeking solace on the Double Ninth.

titleEn: Whispers of Blossoms â€“ Inquiring of the Chrysanthemum
descriptionEn: To inquire of autumn's feelings, few can comprehend, Murmuring softly, hands clasped, I lean on the eastern fence. Who shares this solitary pride, hidden from the world? Yet blooms alike, why must they delay in their time? In the garden, dew and frost bring such solitude, As the wild geese return, can longing ease the ache? Do not say there are none to converse in this world, What harm is there in sharing a few words for a while?
